string.text:
The most popular meat in the Zone. Nutritious and hardly contaminated.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

Bloodsucker meat is stringy and thus not suited for eating. Due to its limited use, the sell value is low.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

A heavy chunk of Chimera meat. Since Chimeras are considered one of the most dangerous creatures, their meat is highly valued by veteran stalkers.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

Meat of mutated dogs is used as a cheap alternative to the more popular boar meat.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

A popular choice in the Zone. Flesh meat has a good taste and high nutritional value.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

A chunk of Lurker meat. Nutritious and hardly contaminated.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

Pseudodog meat is a common dietary component in the Zone. Tasty, with a high nutritional value.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

Similar to bloodsuckers, Psysucker meat is stringy and thus not suited for eating. Due to its limited use, the sell value is low.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

A small portion of Rodent meat. A cheap and commonly found food.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

Most stalkers consider eating Snork meat to be cannibalistic and immoral. However, certain factions, such as bandits and mercenaries, include it in their meals to show their superiority over other groups.
 %c[d_red]Warning: %c[ui_gray_2]Consumption of raw meats, especially meat obtained in the Zone, is associated with major health risks.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] low-tier mutant meat
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cookable

A small hot meal made from Bloodsucker meat, spiced with various herbs and mushrooms.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier cooked meal

A small portion of boar meat, grilled and seasoned with salt and various herbs. The most popular warm meal among stalkers.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cooked meal

A small hot meal of grilled dog chops mixed with various herbs. A cheap alternative to the more popular boar beef.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cooked meal

Slices of greasy, fat bacon cut from the mutated pigs in the zone, commonly referred to as 'Flesh'.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cooked meal

Grilled Snork hand, ready to be eaten. Most stalkers consider eating Snork meat to be cannibalistic and immoral. However, certain factions, such as bandits and mercenaries, include it in their meals to show their superiority over other groups.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cooked meal

A small portion of Lurker meat, grilled and seasoned with salt and various herbs. Good nutritional value due to the mutant's thick muscles.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier cooked meal

A portion of grilled Chimera meat, served with mushrooms and various spices. An expensive meal, eaten most commonly by veteran stalkers to celebrate the accomplishment of difficult missions.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier cooked meal

Portion of grilled Pseudodog meat chops. Good nutritional value due to the creature's thick muscles.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cooked meal

A small hot meal made from Psysucker meat, spiced with various herbs and mushrooms.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] high-tier cooked meal

Small skewered Tushkanos, grilled and seasoned with salt and various herbs. The cheapest hot meal available in the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] cooked meal

The leg of a Boar. The hoofs of boars found in the zone have been used to produce various drugs.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Bloodsucker's hearts secrete special enzymes which halt the coagulation process caused by incompatible blood types. Scientific study of the enzyme could solve the problem of blood donor issues for patients with rare blood types.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Bloodsucker tentacles contain a special gland which produces an enzyme capable of dissolving the skin and simultaneously preventing blood from clotting. Discovering the enzyme's composition could be the cornerstone of a whole series of great medical advances. Some stalkers use bloodsucker teeth to make necklaces and charms.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Posing a considerable threat to anything caught in its way, the fangs of mutant boars in the exclusion zone spans an average length of 30 centimeters, though it is of no particular interest to scientists due to its lackluster composition and strength. The fang is commonly used as a trophy among stalkers and has become a collector's item outside of the Zone.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Burers have telepathic skills yet to be understood by the science community. The brain's mass is 1.5 to 2.5 times bigger than a human brain. Though because of its size and structure, the brain can be easily damaged during extraction. These are highly sought-after by scientists.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The hand of a Burer. These seem to play a vital role in the creature's use of their telekinetic powers. Scientists will gladly examine it in hope of finding the source of mutation.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Cat's claws have an unknown molecular structure but are known to be very sharp. Scientists and military believe that a thorough study will help in the creation of new, highly durable materials and armor.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Cats in the Zone are bigger than their pet cousins and are very dangerous predators, capable of moving swiftly and without sound. Within the stalker community, a cat's tail is a symbol of awareness and competency.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The thyroid of a mutated cat. This gland has multiplied in size due to a sustained occupancy within the exclusion zone. This resulted in the need for increased food intake, increased activity, behaviour changes and hair loss. These traits have allowed the creatures to quickly displace their healthy relatives and occupy a higher position in the food chain.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The claw of a Chimera. Its exact molecular composition is unknown, but it is as durable and sharp as a diamond.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The heart of a Chimera. It has grown into a double-organ that can function as a reserve blood supply and regenerate tissue damage. This allows the Chimera to withstand heavy injuries without backing out of a fight. It is sought after to aid in the study of Siamese twin death rates.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The horn of a Chimera. Its exact molecular composition is unknown, but the tip is as durable and sharp as a diamond. This item is in high demand as it is visibly similar to a rhino horn.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Controllers have potent mental powers that originate from the brain. Scientific studies have found that every mutant possessing abilities related to psy-waves have a brain of similar structure. The scientists will pay handsomely for this tissue.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The hand of a Controller. The scientists will gladly examine it in the hope of finding the source of mutation responsible for its psy-related powers.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

While in pursuit, a mutated dog's heart can reach up to 250 beats per minute, which is unthinkable for non-atherogenic, healthy individuals of the same weight category. This endurance makes their heart an interesting subject for study.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The liver of a dog. Having undergone severe changes due to a toxic diet and a lack of clean drinking water in the Zone, the liver is of particular interest to scientists due to its potential in aiding research in medicine for liver diseases.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Resistance of mutant dog skin to electricity and chemical agents has been the object of scientific interest for a long time. Due to the absence of fat tissue, the tail is especially suited for lab tests.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The mutated, swollen eye of a Flesh which has the miraculous ability of regeneration. The discovery of the mechanism this feat would most certainly revolutionize modern medicine.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The severed hand of a Fracture. It is certain that these creatures used to be humans and are the direct result of the second Chernobyl incident.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The mutated eye of a Lurker. The glow surrounding the pupil made the Lurker's eye a matter of interest among local hunters.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The tail of a Lurker. Scientific studies suggest that the characteristics of a Lurker tail are proof that their are a mutant species of Tushkano.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

While many stalkers consider crows no more than pests, more insightful individuals pulverize the beaks to be used in creating special mixtures.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Pseudodog fangs are not particularly strong and are routinely replaced throughout life. Scientists are not particularly interested in them.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The tail of a Pseudodog. The fur is reportedly incredibly soft and could provide warmth even in the most vicious of snowstorms. For these reasons, Pseudodog tails are in high demand.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The eye of a Pseudogiant. It has the appearance of a human eye with a multi-coloured iris and exceptionally well-developed tear glands.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The hand of a Pseudogiant. Due to the inhumane physical powers of these dangerous behemoths, it is understandable that a specimen like this is rare to come by.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The hand of a Psysuckers. The scientists will gladly examine it in the hope of finding the source responsible for its psy-related powers.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Snork feet and legs contain a huge number of highly elastic tendons, explaining the beast's ability to perform its characteristically long leaps.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

Masks worn by Snorks are apparently a version of the GP-5, a Soviet gas mask commonly used by soldiers as well as research and utility crews operating in the Zone when the second Chernobyl disaster occurred. The mask, although broken beyond use, is still in demand by the scientific community.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The head of a Tushkano. The scientists would like to study it to identify which creature or creatures Tushkanos originate from.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen

The hand of a former human who lived or worked in the Exclusion Zone and were subjected to extreme amounts of radiation and psy-influence when the second Chernobyl incident occurred.
 
 %c[ui_gray_3]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] scientific specimen
